website_summaries.verdict: This stainless steel potato masher from chef Jamie Oliver is ideal for home cooks who prefer the smooth results of a ricer, but with the control of a masher.
pros: Sturdy construction, works more like a ricer than a traditional masher
Long handle keeps hands away from hot food
Curved ergonomic handle provides solid grip
Smaller profile, easy to store in standard kitchen drawers
cons: Inner holes are small, more pulverizing than mashing
Hard metal surface can damage bowls and nonstick pans

customer_reviews.title: This Stainless Steel is not the high grade rust proof type.
customer_reviews.text: This item has a nice feel to it and it looks good. Although the description states that it is stainless steel it is not a high grade of stainless so some rusting may occur. I think the cost is too high. Mine had damage to the handle so it was returned.
customer_reviews.author: Hermit Hank

customer_reviews.title: Jamie Oliver, you killed it. I've been putting ...
customer_reviews.text: Jamie Oliver, you killed it. I've been putting off buying a food ricer/food mill, one day. Needed a masher to smash my blueberries for my yogurt in the morning. My old masher was cheap and rusting. Unsure how this will work in say making mash potatoes or other common dishes that involve mashing. But as I described for my intended use it is spot on it produces a product with the consistency of masher/food mill. Also if you are masking mash potatoes and not using a food mill treat yo self.
customer_reviews.author: stefan

customer_reviews.title: WELL MADE POTATO MASHER
customer_reviews.text: This is a well made potato masher. It has a good hand feel. I believe it's made so one side of the handle can scrape the pan. It's heavy duty. I bought this for my son as a gift since he mentioned that he would like another style of potato masher. He opened it on Christmas, just in time to mash potatoes for Christmas dinner.
customer_reviews.author: Carol B. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: What a masher!
customer_reviews.text: This is the most solid masher I’ve come across, a heavy duty tool that should last a lifetime. It mashes by ricing, making it harder harder to push the potatoes through than smashing them with a coil style masher, but doing a beautiful job . No worries about any part bending or breaking no matter how large a batch you’re mashing . This is a hefty tool, but its well designed handle makes it comfortable to grip. Heartily recommend.
customer_reviews.author: A. Quint

customer_reviews.title: Top quality masher
customer_reviews.text: We had an Echo brand masher for nearly 30 years. When it appeared to be on its last leg, I spotted an OXO brand compact masher that I thought would work great (I have been a fan of OXO products for many years). The very first time using the OXO, the masher bent on me (plus the design puts your knuckles too close to steaming potatoes). I reported this to OXO and they sent me a new one. In the meantime, I had already replaced the OXO with this Jamie Oliver masher... very well constructed, good grip and your hand is a safe distance from scalding steam. Trying to figure out what to do with my OXO spare???
customer_reviews.author: Dewey Bumstead

customer_reviews.title: Awesome masher!
customer_reviews.text: Little late writing this review but better late than never. Awesome masher, sturdy and gets the job done. I also bought one for a relative with a large family... no problems it has held up and keeps going.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Smith

customer_reviews.title: smash smash smash!
customer_reviews.text: this lil potato smasher is amazing! i shouldnt say lil cause its actually a pretty good size. very heavy duty! i got this to replace my old timey squiggle line wire one, which, frankly, i dont know how that thing was ever designed to make smooth mashed potatoes. this one is awesome! very easy to use! the gripper handle is a nice touch for the big batches where your hand may get sore after a few minutes of smashing. i love this thing and could easily see me using it in the future, not only to smash the life out of potatoes but to also tenderize meat and pound down chicken! no one is safe!
customer_reviews.author: Kat Facepunch

customer_reviews.title: Love this masher!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this masher! I originally purchased this in 2011 and it just broke. I am so happy to find it again and ordered it. I used this utensil a lot and loved how it for my hand and how well it worked. Great utensil for the money!
customer_reviews.author: sheart

customer_reviews.title: Work great & feels good in hand!!
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful masher. Does the job quickly. I'm not very strong but this felt good n my hands & worked perfect. Fist time I mashed potatoes they came out too creamy (we like a few chunks!)
customer_reviews.author: C. P. Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking locally for years trying to find a sturdy kitchen tool for smashing beans. Found this on Amazon and I've been extremely pleased with it. The central handle that is supported on both sides of the utensil gives it strength that I was missing in other purchases. Easy to use. Easy to clean. Well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for anyone who loves mashed potatoes....so..everyone.
customer_reviews.text: This is the best potato masher of all time. It's so easy to use and does a great job of mashing potatoes up quickly and the end with the scraper ensures that potatoes don't get stuck to the side of the pan. It's really nicely made and I don't doubt that it'll last me a long time. If you need a new one..or even if you don't..get it.
customer_reviews.author: AshDelDebbio

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, comfortable, effective
customer_reviews.text: I really like the sturdiness of this masher. The rubber handle is comfortable and gives a good grip. The rubber scraper is more gimmick than useful, as the curvature of the handle keeps most of it well away from the side of the container.
customer_reviews.author: David Turner

customer_reviews.title: My, what a big tool!
customer_reviews.text: This is longer than it needs to be, but works fine. I had a good masher, but it always collected water in the handle when washed in the dishwasher. Nothing grosser than old dishwasher water dripping into your food! I took a while to choose its replacement, since all I found in the stores were plastic, silicone or the zigzag wire style. This is the type I wanted. I'm not sure the pot scraper feature really adds much, but the handle is comfortable to use, and it seems solid enough to last a long time. You just need to make sure you'll have room for it if you keep your utensils in a drawer, because it's a big one.
customer_reviews.author: Jennie C.

customer_reviews.title: Good piece
customer_reviews.text: Makes the smashes really easy due the hard material, do the job really well. Super sturdy, price is really worth.
customer_reviews.author: SandyM

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this and the card backing was in the box, not the masher. Amazing offered nothing for the inconvenience. I got a new one, and the product itself is very sturdy and should last for yeard. I had to replace my old one that after 15 years finally fell apart.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn Pierson

customer_reviews.title: Mashes great but use only with glassware
customer_reviews.text: First the positive: Mashes potatoes to a smooth consistency. Feels natural in the hand. Easy to clean. Why it rates a four and not a Five: It scotches our stainless steel pans and of course one would never use it on non-stick coated cookware. That leaves only glassware as an acceptable option. Because of this limitation it gets a four.
customer_reviews.author: T Riggs

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for this dreaded job!
customer_reviews.text: As others have stated...this masher is solid and works perfectly with potatoes. The "squeeze" thru design really helps as there is no slipping of potatoes and it squeezes the potatoes thru instead of pushing them aside. you will find this one works outstandingly for this type of work.
customer_reviews.author: Love movies that make you think.

customer_reviews.title: What beautiful quality!
customer_reviews.text: I got my new masher a few days ago and last night used it to make mashed potatoes for dinner. It takes a little "elbow grease" but once you make one trip around the pan, the rest is easy. I mashed and mashed, and then added butter and cream and mashed some more. Hubby said the potatoes were great, veeeeery creamy. This masher is heavy and VERY well made. No seams to work loose. I love my new masher. My friend in Australia has ordered herself one after seeing mine. Oh and it fits nicely in my drawer too. If you are looking for a top quality masher, this is it! You won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Kaye

customer_reviews.title: This is a great masher. I had a plastic one and my ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great masher. I had a plastic one and my mom would always complain that it wasn’t sturdy enough so I found this one & it works great. She was so happy when she came to cook for Easter.
customer_reviews.author: LaTane

customer_reviews.title: This masher is very sturdy, with stainless surfaces that make it pretty easy ...
customer_reviews.text: This masher is very sturdy, with stainless surfaces that make it pretty easy to clean ss well. The handle is comfortably curved and ergonomic. It's appearance is sleek and cooler, much nicer than I expected from the picture.
customer_reviews.author: Krzysztof Koziara

customer_reviews.title: Life changing
customer_reviews.text: I don't know how I lived so long without this masher. SO STURDY. Very efficient. My mother and grandmother were both asking where I found it!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Do the Mashed Potatoes!
customer_reviews.text: I'm always skeptical about "endorsed" kitchen gadgets, but I've found Jamie's brand to be well-made as well as working well. Same goes for his peelers. The asymmetrical design allows you to easily use the masher against the side of a straight wall sauce pan.
customer_reviews.author: pmthomas

customer_reviews.title: WOW!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Best masher on the planet; Even does turnips with ease!!!
customer_reviews.author: M. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great and strong.
customer_reviews.text: Very strong and sturdy! Great to use when I'm making certain baby food. Can handle a lot of pressure and won't buckle.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Definitely Heavy Duty
customer_reviews.text: This unit is definitely heavy duty. This thing should last forever. Its very comfortable in my hand. I have a little arthritis and comfort is important to me. I definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Sqwirly

customer_reviews.title: Multi purpose tool, great for home protection!
customer_reviews.text: The Jamie Oliver Stainless Steel Masher is of a sleek, sturdy and stylish design that will flatten the fiercest home intruder, allowing for easy removal by law enforcement authorities. But Wait! There's more. It's easy to clean design will quickly transform your new home defense bludgeon into a sanitary tool for mashing even the most stubborn vegetables or other edibles destined for your fine dining experience. The Jamie Oliver Stainless Steel Masher is a great addition to your kitchen, that will likely last at least long enough for your children to fight over it after your long and happy life of mashing vegetables and whacking burglars.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: this thing rocks
customer_reviews.text: I have bought several potato mashers over the last few months in an effort to find a good one, and this one is absolutely the best of the lot. It is made of very heavy metal so it doesn't bend, and it smashes even undercooked potatoes. The size is perfect - small enough to fit into a smaller bowl for avocados, but large enough to handle a big batch of potatoes. And it is tall enough that you don't burn your hands when you first dig in and the handle has rubber for a good grip. The holes are different sizes so you get a fairly smooth consistency. This is the one I use now.
customer_reviews.author: David D Henderson

customer_reviews.title: Smasher
customer_reviews.text: I thought by the look of it on the computer that it was small and would in a small bowl fir my eggs but it’s a lot bigger than what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Shari H.

customer_reviews.title: Great modern masher
customer_reviews.text: We bought this hoping to have found a quick way to mash up some foods for our infant than resorting to pulling out the blender/food processor. It works great for that purpose making a fine mash that is not too chunky for a little one. We have also found we use it for ourselves quite a bit as well. We regularly mash up avocado and spread it on sandwiches now using this masher----delicious. Easy to use, easy to wash. Thank you Jamie Oliver!
customer_reviews.author: swedishchef

customer_reviews.title: Well Built Product and Comfortable Too
customer_reviews.text: Great masher, very good quality and the best part about it is the sturdy handle. It is comfortable in your hands and has a non-slip grip which makes the mashing even easier. Worth the few dollars more over the other products, you'll keep this one for years and will never need to purchase another again.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Size is important
customer_reviews.text: the different size holes makes the crushing job quicker. The bolder handle is very easy to use by a person with larger hands.
customer_reviews.author: Columbus

customer_reviews.title: It Mashes
customer_reviews.text: I use it at my restaurant, where we do 20-pound batches, and this masher is a big improvement over the farberware one I had been using. It's pretty heavy, which helps mash the potatoes, but unless you have a lot to do, you might want to mash with something lighter.
customer_reviews.author: lizwoods

customer_reviews.title: like this
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy and well made. Have used for guacamole and potatos and it works great. Like the scraper feature which is handy when using a bowl
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Is it weird that I love a potato masher this much
customer_reviews.text: Is it weird that I love a potato masher this much. The first time I used it was to make refried beans and it was love at first sight. It sort of rices the potato so when you add the milk it's nice and creamy. The rubber scrapper on the side is nice.
customer_reviews.author: thrifty momma

customer_reviews.title: Much more comfortable grip.
customer_reviews.text: An "Old fashioned" style of masher with a more cerebral contour in design.
customer_reviews.author: Hal 10974

customer_reviews.title: The masher you need, and the last you'll ever buy.
customer_reviews.text: This tool makes mashing an easy task. Even scrapes the side of the bowl. The handle feels soft and comfortable to grip. The design ensures that your grip is secure. Easy on the eyes and arms. It's also easy to clean and not hard to store at all.
customer_reviews.author: Alexia

customer_reviews.title: this is a good product-very well made and does the job-don't have to ...
customer_reviews.text: this is a good product-very well made and does the job-don't have to always use my hand mixer for mashed potatoes
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great masher
customer_reviews.text: Great quality, really sturdy, feels good to hold it, and rubber stripe on the side is an amazing addition for this thing, you will not damage your pot while removing leftovers of mashed food from it.

customer_reviews.title: Feels great.
customer_reviews.text: I had to replace my potato masher that was 30 years old. I bought this one and it is great. Will get another 30 years out of this one. Feels great in the hands especially since I'm in my 60's now and my hands aren't what they were 30 years ago. Amazing how potato mashers have evolved and improved!
customer_reviews.author: Carol Frances

customer_reviews.title: Great masher!
customer_reviews.text: This masher is solid yet light and easy to maneuver. The shaped handle makes mashing easier. For the first time I don't feel like my masher might bend or break as I'm using it. The consistency of what is mashed is even after just a few passes - no big lumps to chase. I'm very satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: LindyLouTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Great masher!
customer_reviews.text: This masher is very well made! It's sturdy thick metal. With a comfortable grip handle. Mashed potatoes came out nice and creamy, no lumps.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna D

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice, solid masher of good quality. Very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: mashes ‘em TFU
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. Great design, includes a scraper on one side to scrape the bowl/pot. Def recommend if you want to mash ‘em well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Get this masher!
customer_reviews.text: This masher is wonderful. It is comfortable to use, the handle doesn't slip out of your hand, and it has a nice weight to it. I got my potatoes mashed in much, much less time than those awful zig-zag mashers, ugh. I'm quite happy with this. The construction is solid so I can see it lasting me many more years. Buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Suz

customer_reviews.title: Nice masher but bulky.
customer_reviews.text: I like this masher, because such version I had to use in my childhood. I can't say that the quality of steel is good but so far it survived through several washes. One small item to mention - it is pretty bulky/big.
customer_reviews.author: Ksenia

customer_reviews.title: Five star masher
customer_reviews.text: Cannot imagine anyone would give it a bad or mediocre review. I found it sturdy, comfortable in my hand, and easy to clean. It did its job well, mashing potatoes quickly and easily. I think it should last for years!
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: Substantial & Gets the Job Done!
customer_reviews.text: Used this for the first time last night. Absolutely fantastic product. I didn't know I could get so excited about a potato masher, but I am! It's strong, and I like the fact that it's also long. No strain on the wrist, either. Actually looking forward to using it again!
customer_reviews.author: USMCMomNRet

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Sir Jamie Oliver knows a thing or two about prep and this makes potatoes stand up into a fluffy delight!!
customer_reviews.author: Linda Adkins-Scolaro

customer_reviews.title: VERY NICE MASHER
customer_reviews.text: I got this to repalce a masher. It is stainless steel it looks good and has a nice weight to it. Sure you can buy cheaper mashers but if you want something a little bit nicer it's a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: M. Young

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I've used it several times and this is the best masher I've had!

customer_reviews.title: Perfect sise
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size and great quality. Handle not too long and bowl of spoon holds a generous amount of food. Have purchased slotted spoons and solid spoons since this buy. Am going to purchase the set for my daughter for her birthday.
customer_reviews.author: Kentucky Polar Bear

customer_reviews.title: Works even better than we hoped!
customer_reviews.text: We took America's Test Kitchen's recommendation and purchased this type of potato masher - outstanding.
customer_reviews.author: Heath Luehmann

customer_reviews.title: This thing is a beast
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a beast. I love it. It will smash up potatoes and not bend like every other potato masher I ever purchased. I highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Go-Illini

customer_reviews.title: I use for chick peas - not as easy as the vitamin but i like the different texture
customer_reviews.text: I haven't tried on potatoes. I use for chick peas - not as easy as the vitamin but i like the different texture.

customer_reviews.title: Great masher!
customer_reviews.text: Works great, best masher 'Ive ever used. Handle is very ergonomic so you can apply force more evenly.

customer_reviews.text: I use this to make guacamole, it works perfectly! I would think it would work well with potatoes as well!

customer_reviews.title: Heavy weight means less labor in mashing, good product
customer_reviews.text: This seems to be genuine 18/10 stainless which is what I hoped for and is the reason I purchased it but the bonus is that this thing is heavy enough in weight to make mashing much, much easier. Good product.
customer_reviews.author: R.L. Dioxin

customer_reviews.title: I can't define exactly what makes this perfect, but it is
customer_reviews.text: It seems ridiculous to be too effusive about a potato masher. How different can they be, right? I can't define exactly what makes this perfect, but it is. Something about the ergonomics of the thing makes me look forward to mashing potatoes - and anything else I can think of: avocados for guacamole, bananas for banana bread, I'm sure I'll find more. Putting one in everyone's Christmas stocking this year!
customer_reviews.author: Suz Eckes

customer_reviews.title: I was pleased. Sturdy with a comfortable handle
customer_reviews.text: First time using a hand masher and it worked very well. I was pleased. Sturdy with a comfortable handle!
customer_reviews.author: Monica

customer_reviews.title: Love this masher
customer_reviews.text: I would absolutely recommend this masher. I purchased it for my husband for Christmas and it works great, he loves it. The best thing about the masher is how sturdy and heavy it is. Much better than those $.99 ones you can buy at Walmart.
customer_reviews.author: kcz

customer_reviews.title: I did a lot of searching before choosing this one ...
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of searching before choosing this one. So far - I give it a high rating. Well-built

customer_reviews.title: Excellent potato masher
customer_reviews.text: This is the best out of several potato mashers I've tried. The handle on this one is longer making potato mashing easier than most others.
customer_reviews.author: Dan L

customer_reviews.title: Love The Size
customer_reviews.text: Very nice ladle. I love the handle being a bit shorter than most cooking utensils, much easier to use than one with a super long handle.
customer_reviews.author: Lynne

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: I've only used this ladle a couple of times, but so far I am pleased. It is solidly built and holds a good amount of liquid. I'll keep an eye out for corrosion and will update my review if necessary.
customer_reviews.author: The Eye

customer_reviews.title: Nice and sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: Nice and sturdy tool. While others tend to bend or get disfigured from pressure this one really holds up. Perfect for mushing up beans, potatoes, ground beef, etc. Happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Esther

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty like crazy, no flexing at all which is what I hated about my previous one. It's been through many dishwasher washings without any signs of wear. Surprised by the side squeegee feature; I actually use it.
customer_reviews.author: B Family

customer_reviews.title: This makes great potatoes. I'm sure glad I chose this one ...
customer_reviews.text: This makes great potatoes. I'm sure glad I chose this one to replace the one I had for 40 years! It does the job quickly and efficiently.
customer_reviews.author: S. M. Norris

customer_reviews.title: Most Chef branded products I find to be s***.
customer_reviews.text: But not this one. So well designed, durable and works like a charm. I'll say it once more, so we'll designed.
customer_reviews.author: oliver brink

customer_reviews.title: Very bulky
customer_reviews.text: The side scraper doesn't help much. You'll still need a real spetula to scrape the bowl AND the masher.
customer_reviews.author: C. Chen

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I have been looking for one of these for mash potatoes because well the plastic just doesn't work like the metal ones. So after looking on here found this and well it is amazing I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Kaitlin A.

customer_reviews.title: Best masher ever
customer_reviews.text: I really love this masher. We have been hand mashing potatoes forever and can't believe we have lived this long with an inferior masher. This masher is so sturdy, and the scraping edge on the side is brilliant. Just does a great job.
customer_reviews.author: Anne

customer_reviews.title: GREAT!!!!
customer_reviews.text: VERY Pleased with this product! Exactly What I Wanted for my need!! The Quality is EXCEPTIONAL!! STURDY!! Not Cheaply Constructed!!

customer_reviews.title: Does a terrific job on the avocados
customer_reviews.text: Excellent for making guacamole. Shape works well with rounded bowls.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Solid, sturdy, and reliable. I was using a very shoddy plastic masher previously and this is a VERY substantial upgrade. Better than anything you're going to see in Target, Walmart, etc.

customer_reviews.title: Smashing!
customer_reviews.text: This is a workhorse of a masher! It's a solid, quality piece of equipment. Save yourself time and effort in the kitchen by using this Jamie Oliver Stainless Steel Masher for all your mashing needs!

customer_reviews.title: Nice Masher
customer_reviews.text: Really like this potato masher. Works great, washes well in the dishwasher!

customer_reviews.title: Solid Masher
customer_reviews.text: This one is worth it. Good price and fast delivery. Would buy from this seller again. Not flimsy. Our first masher lasted 20 years-this one should last at least that long.

customer_reviews.title: Love this. Refered this to others who have purchased
customer_reviews.text: Love this. Refered this to others who have purchased. Has a nice solid grip and NOT wobbly like so many others. Does a great job!

customer_reviews.title: Jamie Oliver Stainless Steel Masher
customer_reviews.text: Finally a strong potato Masher. We were lucky, We had My Mother's Masher from the 1940's, It's great to have a nice new shinny masher that mashes the potatos to perfection.

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: A very well conceived product with the built in bowl scraper!

customer_reviews.text: Very nice and heavy. Can’t say that it was as amazing as I had hoped from some of the reviews, but it looks like it will last a long time and that’s always good with kitchen gadgets.

customer_reviews.title: Feels like a well made masher
customer_reviews.text: Arrived promptly and well packaged. Feels like a well made masher, and will give it with a present at Christmas.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy masher
customer_reviews.text: I bought one for myself and one for each of my daughters. We haven't used it yet but are impressed with how durable & sturdy it seems to be. I also like the built-in scraper on the side of it. The masher was quite the conversation piece at our family Christmas gift opening. I think my nieces are going to order one too.

customer_reviews.title: Happy masher
customer_reviews.text: Waited and looked along time to find just the right one. Well worth the wait

customer_reviews.title: mother of all spud mashers
customer_reviews.text: The mother of all spud mashers. Just add lashings of butter.

customer_reviews.text: We couldn't locate our close to a million year old masher last time we wanted mashed potatoes. I order this and was extremely pleased that our mashed potatoes are creamier than ever.

customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Does a good job and comfortable grip.

customer_reviews.title: Best potatoes ever

product_meta.title: JAMIE OLIVER Stainless Steel Masher
product_meta.description:
Style Name:Potato Masher

MASHER
BY JAMIE OLIVER
Create a just-right texture with the Masher from Jamie Oliver. This sturdy, classic kitchen tool is reinvented with two sizes of holes for quick mashing without leaving any lumps and a built-in silicone bowl scraper to remove everything you mash out of the bowl. Constructed of durable brushed stainless steel with a soft-grip handle for comfortable use, the Masher can be used for a variety of everyday tasks in a wide array of recipes including mashed potatoes and other root vegetables, guacamole, bean dips and more. The Masher includes a hanging hole for convenient storage and is dishwasher safe for easy cleaning. The Masher measures 11 inches (28 centimeters) long.

KEY FEATURES:
 * Built-in silicone bowl scraper
 * Two sizes of holes for quick and effective mashing
 * Durable brushed stainless steel construction
 * Soft-grip handle for comfort
 * Hanging hole for rail storage
 * Dishwasher safe for easy cleaning
 * Measures 11 inches (28 centimeters) long

USE YOUR JAMIE OLIVER MASHER IN THESE AND OTHER RECIPES
SMASHED ROOT VEGGIES
This simple recipe pairs perfectly with roasted meats and other seasonal dishes

INGREDIENTS

 * Sea salt
 * 1.6 pounds of potatoes, peeled, cut into large chunks
 * 3 large carrots, peeled and cut into small chunks
 * 1/2 large rutabaga, peeled and cut into small chunks
 * 2.6-ounces butter

METHOD

Put your potatoes, carrots and rutabaga into a large pot of boiling salted water and boil hard for 20 minutes or so until you can slide a knife into the rutabaga easily. Drain and allow to steam dry, then smash them up in the pan with most of the butter. If you prefer a smooth texture, add some cooking water. Spoon into a bowl, cover with tinfoil and keep warm over a pan of simmering water.

Dish in to a bowl and serve at the table.

FOOD & HOME PRODUCTS
Jamie's passion for fresh, honest and delicious food forms the basis for his brilliant range of food and kitchenware products, which ranges from oils and vinegars to kitchen spices, and gadgets to must-have tools.

ABOUT JAMIE OLIVER
Jamie Oliver is a phenomenon in the world of food. He is the author of best selling cookbooks including "Jamie's 30 Minute Meals", operates multiple restaurants across the UK, provides training for young chefs through the Fifteen restaurant group, and is one of the world's best loved TV personalities on multiple series including The Naked Chef (BBC) and the Emmy Award-winning Jamie's Food Revolution (ABC).

As a chef and teacher, Jamie has inspired people to spend more time enjoying being in the kitchen--and even start growing their own food. Jamie lives in London and Essex with his wife, Jools and his kids, Poppy, Daisy, Petal and Buddy.

SMASHED CELERIAC
DELICIOUSLY TASTY, ALMOST-MASH
What a surprisingly simple and comforting veg dish. Unfortunately everyone seems to be completely baffled by celeriac, but it's beautiful in soups or thinly sliced into salads. When roasted it goes sweet and when mixed with potato and mashed it's a complete joy.

INGREDIENTS

 * 1 celeriac, peeled
 * Olive oil
 * 1 handful fresh thyme, leaves picked
 * 2 cloves garlic, finely chopped
 * Sea salt
 * Freshly ground black pepper
 * 3-4 tablespoons water or organic stock

METHOD

Slice about 1/2-inch off the bottom of your celeriac and roll it on to that flat edge, so it's nice and safe to slice. Slice and dice it all up into 1/2-inch-ish cubes. Don't get your ruler out – they don't have to be perfect. Put a casserole-type pot on a high heat, add 3 good lugs of olive oil, then add the celeriac, thyme and garlic, with a little seasoning. Stir around to coat and fry quite fast, giving a little colour, for 5 minutes. 

Turn the heat down to a simmer, add the water or stock, place a lid on top and cook for around 25 minutes, until tender. Season carefully to taste and stir around with a spoon and smash up the celeriac gently with your Jamie Oliver Masher. Some people like to keep it in cubes, some like to mash it, but I think it looks and tastes much better if you smash it, which is somewhere in the middle. You can serve this with just about any meat you can think of.

Brushed stainless steel with soft-grip handle insert
Integrated silicone bowl scraper removes everything you mash from bowl with less wastage
Small inner holes and larger outer holes for quick mashing without leaving any lumps
